subject: Re: [junit] Any tools for Test Case generation?
msgSnippet: ... The idea of automatically generating tests is incompatible with the JUnit (and xUnit) philosophy. JUnit is a framework in which humans write tests; it is
messageBody:
>So said hehaifengcn on 2003-06-10 --------------------
>I have a project in which I want to some tools that can automatically
>generate test case to exercise given execution path. The path is
>derived from bytecode but may be ablt to map back to source code
>level.
>
>For example, I have a fuction
>
>void fun(int a, int b)
>{
>1 a=b;
>2 if (a<b){
>3 x=a;
>4 }else{
>5 x=b;
>6}
>7
>}
>
>And suppose I want the execution path is (1,2, 3, 7). I need a tool
>for generating an input for the path.
>
>I try to use JTest but not able to find any feature in Jtest which
>can do the task. I wonder if there any tool which has that feature?
>Can JUnit perform it?

The idea of automatically generating tests is incompatible with the JUnit (and xUnit) philosophy. JUnit is a framework in which humans write tests; it is not a tool that writes tests.

An interesting question for you: how do you expect any program to know the expected result for each code path? The key point of tests is to compare an expected result to the actual result. How is it possible for a non-human to know the expected result?

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
